intro: Sphacele lancifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sphacele, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Sphacele lancifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
